dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, we've been seeing a lot about Elon Musk in the news lately, you know, with all the legal stuff. And an article just came out, uh, confirming his fortune.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, we've been seeing a lot about Elon Musk in the news lately, you know, with all the legal stuff. And an article just came out, uh, confirming his fortune.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Tesla and SpaceX CEO confirmed he has roughly a $20 billion fortune (Forbes pegs it at $23.6 billion), but added that his liquid assets are relatively low.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I saw that. Forbes, I think, pegs him at around $33.6 billion, but he actually admitted to about 30 himself, which is, like, still an insane amount of money.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I saw that. Forbes, I think, pegs him at around thirty three point six billion, but he actually admitted to about thirty himself, which is, like, still an insane amount of money.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Tesla and SpaceX CEO confirmed he has roughly a $20 billion fortune (Forbes pegs it at $23.6 billion)...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? But the interesting part was, he said his liquid assets are pretty high. He actually said, and I quote, "Some people think I have a lot of cash... And I do."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? But the interesting part was, he said his liquid assets are pretty high. He actually said, and I quote, Some people think I have a lot of cash... And I do.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...but added that his liquid assets are relatively low. Some people think I have a lot of cash, he said. I actually dont.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] "And I do!" I mean, that's a flex, right? Especially with this trial looming, you wonder what that means for him.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And I do! I mean, that's a flex, right? Especially with this trial looming, you wonder what that means for him.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. The article suggests that if there's a big judgment against him, he might have to sell off some investments. It even mentions like, a stake in Walmart or Blue Origin, which is kinda wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. The article suggests that if there's a big judgment against him, he might have to sell off some investments. It even mentions like, a stake in Walmart or Blue Origin, which is kinda wild.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If the jury levels a large judgment against Musk, he may have to sell part of his stake in Tesla or SpaceX, a move he has historically avoided.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Walmart? Huh. I didn't even know he had holdings there. But I guess if you're that wealthy, your portfolio is, uh, pretty diverse.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Walmart? Huh. I didn't even know he had holdings there. But I guess if you're that wealthy, your portfolio is, uh, pretty diverse.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, well, Forbes estimates about 80% of his wealth is actually tied up in shares of Tesla and SpaceX. So that explains, you know, why he might have that high liquidity.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, well, Forbes estimates about eighty percent of his wealth is actually tied up in shares of Tesla and SpaceX. So that explains, you know, why he might have that high liquidity.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As much as 99% of Musks wealth is held in shares of those two companies, Forbes estimates, which helps explain his lack of liquidity.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, that makes sense. So, like, cash from bonuses, and then the rest is tied up in his companies.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, that makes sense. So, like, cash from bonuses, and then the rest is tied up in his companies.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much. And get this, for someone worth tens of billions, his debt is actually relatively low. Less than a hundred million, with a good chunk of that collateralized by his SpaceX stake.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much. And get this, for someone worth tens of billions, his debt is actually relatively low. Less than a hundred million, with a good chunk of that collateralized by his SpaceX stake.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: More important, Musk, 48, owes more than $500 million in debts, according to financial documents published earlier this year. ... Musk has pledged nearly half of his Tesla stake as collateral for those loans.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow, that's, uh, surprisingly responsible for such a, you know, bombastic character. So, what else did the article touch on?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow, that's, uh, surprisingly responsible for such a, you know, bombastic character. So, what else did the article touch on?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, it briefly went into his past, you know, selling X.com to Microsoft, which was his first big fortune. But then it talks about, like, his motivations for SpaceX.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, it briefly went into his past, you know, selling X.com to Microsoft, which was his first big fortune. But then it talks about, like, his motivations for SpaceX.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He made his first fortune after selling Zip2, a software firm, to Compaq in 1999 for a reported price of more than $300 million. Three years later Paypal, which he also cofounded, was acquired by eBay for $1.4 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Which is fascinating, right? He said it wasn't just about maximizing riches, but about affecting the future of humanity.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is fascinating, right? He said it wasn't just about maximizing riches, but about affecting the future of humanity.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Instead he founded the space exploration company, he said, because it was his way to most affect the future of humanity and civilization.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. But then, uh, it pivots to his more recent antics. Like, remember 2017 when he tweeted about considering buying Twitter?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. But then, uh, it pivots to his more recent antics. Like, remember twenty seventeen when he tweeted about considering buying Twitter?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In addition to the defamation suit, he stirred controversy in 2018 after tweeting that he was considering taking Tesla private, an announcement that caught investors by surprise.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh my god, [overlaps] yes! That caused such a stir, and then the SEC got involved, didn't they? He had to pay a fine?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh my god, yes! That caused such a stir, and then the S E C got involved, didn't they? He had to pay a fine?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Following an SEC investigation, he paid a $20 million fine and stepped down as the carmakers chairman.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yep. A million-dollar fine, and he had to step down as Tesla's treasurer. Just, you know, peak Elon.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yep. A million-dollar fine, and he had to step down as Tesla's treasurer. Just, you know, peak Elon.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Following an SEC investigation, he paid a $20 million fine and stepped down as the carmakers chairman.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And then, of course, the Cybertruck reveal! The article mentions that infamous moment with the metal ball.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then, of course, the Cybertruck reveal! The article mentions that infamous moment with the metal ball.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Last month, during the introduction of Teslas new Cybertruck, he attempted to prove the durability of the trucks armor glass windows with a metal ball.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: "Oh my fing God!" [chuckles] That's what he said, right? When the windows *didn't* shatter, but, uh, actually broke instead.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh my fing God! That's what he said, right? When the windows didn't shatter, but, uh, actually broke instead.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Instead the window shattered. Oh my fing God, said a surprised Musk.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [laughs] Yeah, and then they tried it again on another window, and that one broke too! But apparently, people are still pre-ordering them like crazy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and then they tried it again on another window, and that one broke too! But apparently, people are still pre-ordering them like crazy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: His chief designer tested another window. Then it shattered, too. Still, Musk reports that more than 250,000 customers have preordered the vehicle.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: I know, right? He even tweeted, "Guess we are ready to go to production haha." You gotta love his confidence, even when things, uh, literally shatter.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know, right? He even tweeted, Guess we are ready to go to production haha. You gotta love his confidence, even when things, uh, literally shatter.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But, he tweeted, Guess we have some improvements to make before production haha.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's never a dull moment with him, is it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's never a dull moment with him, is it?
